title: BDI single-step fails when orientation not close to zero

content.raw:
If the robot has been moved and is no longer facing in the same generatl direction that it started at, sending an AtlasSimInterfaceCommand with a behavior equal to STEP will cause the robot to freeze up and fall over.  This does not happen if the robot has been moved but is still facing the same general direction that it started at.

The attached script can be used to re-produce this behavior.  Running the following commands will cause the robot to turn left using MULTI-STEP and then attempt to take a SINGLE-STEP (with the same pose as the last footstep that was executed using MULTI-STEP):
roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch
./walk_test.py turn multi
./walk_test.py turn single

Running the following commands will cause the robot to walk straight using MULTI-STEP and then successfully take a SINGLE-STEP:
roslaunch atlas_utils atlas_sandia_hands.launch
./walk_test.py straight multi
./walk_test.py straight single
